thread.title: Holly Willoughby teases that she's INTIMIDATED by Scarlett Moffatt's TV presenting plans
thread.title_full: Holly Willoughby teases that she's INTIMIDATED by Scarlett Moffatt's TV presenting plans

author: Peter Lloyd
title: Holly Willoughby teases that she's INTIMIDATED by Scarlett Moffatt's TV presenting plans
text:
Holly Willoughby teases that she's INTIMIDATED by Scarlett Moffatt's TV presenting plans Is the veteran This Morning host feeling threatened by her younger rival?   
She is on the way to becoming a successful telly host, but Scarlett Moffat 's impressive career climb may have unexpected downsides - specifically, annoying fellow TV presenters. 
The Geordie lass, who won I'm A Celebrity in December, has already been snapped up to co-host Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway, but Holly Willoughby has said she's almost intimidating. 
Speaking to the Daily Star Sunday's television guide, TV Life, about her appearance on Play To The Whistle, she said: " Scarlett Moffatt was great. She gets up and in my chair at one point and hosts the show for a bit. 
"We were talking about how she wants to do more presenting, so I was like 'right, have a go!', and she did brilliantly. Almost too good. I was like 'right, get out of my seat, now!'". Bradley Walsh, Holly Willoughby and Frank Lampard on Play to the Whistle (Photo: ITV) Read More Ant McPartlin unimpressed with Scarlett Moffatt's choice of guest as they make shock confession 
The back-handed compliment will surely please Scarlett, who is a relative newcomer in front of the camera. 
Not least because her recent success has had some unfortunate consequences, including seeing her parents axed from Channel 4's Gogglebox. 
Bosses decided to leave mum Betty, dad Mark and sister Ava-Grace out of the next series following her success on I’m A Celebrity. 
While she hasn't slammed Channel 4 for the move, Scarlett has admitted she didn't expect producers to take such extreme measures. Scarlett Moffatt with her mum Betty and Dad Mark, who've been dropped from Gogglebox (Photo: Newcastle Chronicle) Loving life at the 22nd National Television Awards (Photo: Splash News) Read More Scarlett Moffatt scoffs wichetty grub as jungle queen has to relive I'm A Celeb antics for new advert 
Taking to Twitter earlier today, the jungle queen posted a picture of herself with her parents at the National Television Awards. 
She captioned the image: "We are going to miss doing #gogglebox so so much but can’t wait to watch the new series (good luck my fellow goggleboxers you will smash it love the Moffatts)." 
The reality beauty then admitted she was "gutted" her family had been dropped from the show.
